data.title: Critical Care Medicine
data.text:
Evaluating the Sum of Eye and Motor Components of the Glasgow Coma Score As a Predictor of Extubation Failure in Patients With Acute Brain Injury

Taran, Shaurya; Perrot, Bastien; Angriman, Federico; More

Taran, Shaurya; Perrot, Bastien; Angriman, Federico; Cinotti, Raphael; for the Extubation strategies in Neuro-Intensive care unit patients and associations with Outcomes (ENIO) Study Group; on behalf of the PROtective VENTilation network; the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine; the Colegio Mexicano de Medicina Critica; the Atlanréa group, and the Société Française d’Anesthésie et de Réanimation (SFAR) research network; for the Extubation strategies in Neuro-Intensive care unit patients and associations with Outcomes (ENIO) Study Group; on behalf of the PROtective VENTilation network; the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine; the Colegio Mexicano de Medicina Critica; the Atlanréa group, and the Société Française d’Anesthésie et de Réanimation (SFAR) research network; for the Extubation strategies in Neuro-Intensive care unit patients and associations with Outcomes (ENIO) Study Group; on behalf of the PROtective VENTilation network; the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine; the Colegio Mexicano de Medicina Critica; the Atlanréa group, and the Société Française d’Anesthésie et de Réanimation (SFAR) research network; for the Extubation strategies in Neuro-Intensive care unit patients and associations with Outcomes (ENIO) Study Group; on behalf of the PROtective VENTilation network; the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine; the Colegio Mexicano de Medicina Critica; the Atlanréa group, and the Société Française d’Anesthésie et de Réanimation (SFAR) research network; for the Extubation strategies in Neuro-Intensive care unit patients and associations with Outcomes (ENIO) Study Group; on behalf of the PROtective VENTilation network; the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine; the Colegio Mexicano de Medicina Critica; the Atlanréa group, and the Société Française d’Anesthésie et de Réanimation (SFAR) research network Less
